represents.energy: Boosts physical energy levels, increases heart rate and blood pressure, prompts adrenaline release
represents.action: Fast moving, promotes need for action and movement
represents.desire: Relates to physical desire in all its forms - sexual, appetite, cravings
represents.passion: Passionate belief in an issue or undertaking, including love or hate; anger is negative passion

effects.stimulating: Stimulates physical senses, sexual and physical appetite; triggers deeper passions such as sex, love, courage, hatred, revenge
effects.attention_getting: Demands notice, alerts to danger (e.g., red traffic lights and stop signs)
effects.assertive_and_aggressive: Associated with assertiveness and aggression (e.g., drivers of red cars feeling aggressive)

description: A dark bluish red, denotes controlled and more thoughtful action
Softer than burgundy and less dramatic than true red
A dark purplish red, more sophisticated and serious
Indicates controlled power, determined ambition, dignified action
Favored by the wealthy
Has a little blue
Indicates determination to succeed without upsetting others
Emits sensuality rather than sexuality
Has a little orange, gives richness and brightness
Indicates enthusiasm and love of life
Less intense and more fun-loving than true red, tempered with defiance

adventure_and_risk_taking: Orange promotes physical confidence and enthusiasm
Sportsmen and adventure-seekers relate well to orange
social_communication_and_interaction: Orange stimulates two-way conversation between people
In a dining room when entertaining it stimulates conversation as well as appetite
friendship: Wherever people get together to have fun and socialize orange is a good choice
divorce: The optimism of the color orange helps people move on
It is forward thinking and outward thinking

effects.enthusiasm: Orange is optimistic and extroverted - the color of the uninhibited
effects.rejuvenation: Orange helps to restore balance to our physical energies
effects.stimulation: Orange is not as passionate or as excitable as red, but it is stimulating, particularly to the appetite - the worst color to have in the kitchen if you want to lose weight
effects.courage: Orange helps us to take account of our lives, to face the consequences, to take action and make appropriate changes, and then to move onward and upward
effects.vitality: Orange has a more balanced energy than red, not as passionate and aggressive, but full of vitality

description: Peach encourages great communication and conversation
It inspires good manners and puts people at ease
It has all the attributes of orange but in a much softer, gentler and more cautious form
This version of orange encourages vitality and self-control
Amber helps to inspire greater confidence and better self esteem
It can promote a degree of arrogance
This color emits a negative vibration indicating pride, tension and aggressive self-assertion
Dark orange indicates over-confidence and over-ambition
It tries too hard to prove its worth and to boost its self-esteem, but when it fails, which is often, it develops a chip on its shoulder
It is the color of the opportunist, taking selfish advantage of every situation

represents.mind_and_intellect: From a color psychology perspective, yellow stimulates our mental faculties; it activates the left or analytical brain
represents.happiness_and_fun: Yellow is uplifting to the spirits; yellow helps create enthusiasm for life and can awaken greater confidence and optimism
represents.communication_of_new_ideas: Yellow is related to the expression and integration of new ideas and thoughts

effects.creative: The color of new ideas, yellow helps us find new ways of doing things
effects.quick_decisions: Yellow helps with clear thinking and quick decision-making but it can also be impulsive
effects.anxiety_producing: Yellow is fast moving so too much time in its presence can agitate and lead to nervousness and emotional instability
effects.critical: Yellow makes people more mentally analytical and self critical of both themselves and others
effects.non_emotional: Yellow relates to the head not the heart

description: This color helps to clear the mind
Making it open and alert
Lemon yellow promotes self-reliance and a need for an orderly life
This yellow increases our sensitivity to criticism
Citrine is a superficial and fickle color
It encourages the serial relationship hopper, the teaser, with unstable emotions
This yellow can be deceitful and retreats from responsibility
This yellow is the color of the loner with an intense curiosity and interest in investigating the finer details of its interests
Golden yellow is sensitive to criticism
Cream, tinted with a hint of yellow, encourages new ideas
However, this very pale color can also indicate a lack of confidence and a need for reassurance
The darker shades of yellow indicate an inclination toward depression and melancholy, lack of love and low self-worth
Dark yellow relates to the constant complainer and the cynic

positive: Kind and loyal with a high moral sense
Encourages 'social joining' of clubs and other groups

represents.harmony_and_balance: Green is the great balancer of our mental, emotional and physical energies which is why there is so much green on our planet. Green is the heart centre of the body
represents.growth: As in nature, green leaves are an indication the plant is still growing
represents.hope: Green is the anticipation of things to come

effects.rejuvenating: The color green revitalizes us when we are physically, mentally or emotionally exhausted
effects.nurturing: Because of its link with the heart, green urges us to nurture others. Green is also nurturing to us - another reason why it is the most predominant colour on earth
effects.dependable_agreeable_and_diplomatic: The color green helps us to see situations clearly from all sides
effects.possessiveness: Green is a color that encourages us to want to own things and people, to collect and possess. Green encourages materialism
effects.envy: 'Green with envy' is a common phrase and a negative reaction to the color green

description: As the color of new growth on plants, it indicates immaturity, youthfulness and inexperience
It allows us to see things from a new perspective, to make a fresh start
This is an inspiring and uplifting color suggesting abundance and wealth in all its forms, from material wellbeing, to emotional wellbeing to creative ideas
The color of trust and confidentiality, tact and diplomacy
Jade green indicates a generosity of spirit, giving without expecting anything in return
It increases worldly wisdom and understanding, assisting in the search for enlightenment
Lime green inspires youthfulness, naivety and playfulness
It is liked the most by younger people
It creates a feeling of anticipation, and helps to clear the mind of negativity
There is a degree of resentment in dark green
Often used by wealthy businessmen, ambitious and always striving for more wealth
Dark green signifies greed and selfish desire
Aqua calms the spirit, offering protection and healing for the emotions
Although the traditional color for peace, 'offering an olive branch', the color olive suggests deceit and treachery, blaming others for its problems
However there is also a strength of character with it that can overcome adversity to develop an understanding and caring of the feelings of others
This color green suggests cowardice, conflict and fear
Grass green is the color of money
It is self-confident and secure, natural and healthy, occurring in abundance in nature

represents.peace_and_calm: Blue is often associated with calm and serenity
represents.trust_and_loyalty: It symbolizes trust, loyalty and faithfulness
represents.wisdom_and_intelligence: Blue represents intelligence, wisdom and the power of communication

effects.calming: Blue calms the mind and reduces stress
effects.lowering_blood_pressure: It can lower blood pressure and slow respiration
effects.promotes_mental_clarity: Blue promotes clarity of thought and creativity
effects.can_feel_cold: Too much blue may feel cold or depressing

description: Sky blue suggests freedom, imagination and inspiration
It is uplifting and serene
Navy blue is strong and reliable
It denotes authority and trust
Royal blue conveys richness and importance
It is elegant and sophisticated
Powder blue is gentle and calming
It can evoke nostalgia and softness

represents.intuition_and_perception: Indigo is linked to intuition and deep perception
represents.wisdom_and_spirituality: It represents spiritual awareness and wisdom
represents.seriousness_and_mystery: Indigo conveys seriousness, mystery and integrity

effects.promotes_intuition: Indigo encourages inner reflection and intuition
effects.stimulates_spiritual_growth: It supports spiritual growth and meditation
effects.can_feel_intense: The color can feel intense or overwhelming in excess

description: Dark indigo suggests depth and sophistication
It is mysterious and powerful
Indigo blue combines calm blue with mystical purple
It is thoughtful and introspective

represents.creativity_and_wisdom: Purple represents creativity, wisdom, dignity and grandeur
represents.mystery_and_magic: It is linked to mystery, magic and spirituality
represents.luxury_and_independence: Purple is associated with luxury, ambition and independence

effects.calming_effect: It can have a calming and uplifting effect
effects.can_feel_mysterious: Purple may evoke mystery and introspection

description: Lavender is soft and soothing
It suggests youthfulness and tranquility
Violet is deep and rich
It conveys luxury and ambition
Plum is rich and sophisticated
It suggests mystery and creativity

represents.calm_and_balance: Turquoise represents calmness, emotional balance and clarity
represents.creativity_and_healing: It encourages creativity and emotional healing

effects.calming: Turquoise has a calming effect on the mind and body
effects.promotes_clarity: It promotes clear communication and self-expression
effects.can_feel_detached: It can sometimes feel cold or detached

description: Aqua is light and refreshing
It promotes emotional healing and protection
Teal is deep and sophisticated
It suggests balance and rejuvenation

represents.love_and_compassion: Pink symbolizes love, nurturing, and compassion
represents.calmness_and_femininity: It is calming and associated with femininity and kindness

effects.soothing: Pink has a soothing and calming effect
effects.encourages_love: It encourages feelings of love and affection
effects.can_feel_naive: Too much pink may seem naive or weak

description: Baby pink is soft and gentle
It suggests innocence and sweetness
Hot pink is vibrant and energetic
It conveys passion and playfulness
Rose is romantic and elegant
It evokes warmth and comfort

represents.imagination_and_innovation: Magenta symbolizes imagination, innovation, and transformation
represents.compassion_and_kindness: It is associated with compassion and kindness

effects.stimulates_creativity: Magenta stimulates creative thinking and inspiration
effects.encourages_transformation: It encourages personal transformation and growth
effects.can_feel_intense: Magenta can sometimes feel intense or overwhelming

description: Fuchsia is bright and bold
It conveys confidence and energy
Orchid is soft and elegant
It suggests charm and mystery

represents.stability_and_reliability: Brown symbolizes stability, reliability, and honesty
represents.comfort_and_warmth: It represents comfort, warmth, and simplicity

effects.grounding: Brown has a grounding and stabilizing effect
effects.promotes_security: It promotes feelings of security and safety
effects.can_feel_dull: Too much brown may feel dull or conservative

description: Tan is light and natural
It suggests simplicity and calmness
Chocolate is rich and warm
It evokes comfort and security
Umber is dark and earthy
It suggests strength and reliability

represents.neutrality_and_balance: Gray symbolizes neutrality, balance, and sophistication

effects.calming: Gray has a calming and stabilizing effect
effects.promotes_detachment: It can promote detachment and reserve
effects.can_feel_dull: Too much gray may feel dull or depressing

description: Light gray is soft and neutral
It suggests calmness and balance
Slate gray is strong and serious
It evokes professionalism and formality
Charcoal gray is deep and sophisticated
It suggests power and elegance

represents.power_and_elegance: Black symbolizes power, elegance, and sophistication

effects.stimulates_power: Black can evoke feelings of power and control
effects.creates_mystery: It adds a sense of mystery and sophistication
effects.can_feel_oppressive: Too much black may feel oppressive or intimidating

description: Jet black is pure and intense
It suggests strength and formality
Charcoal black is softer and muted
It conveys seriousness and depth

represents.purity_and_cleanliness: White symbolizes purity, cleanliness, and simplicity

effects.creates_space: White can make spaces feel larger and more open
effects.can_feel_cold: Too much white may feel cold or sterile

description: Ivory is warm and soft
It suggests elegance and calmness
Snow white is bright and pure
It evokes freshness and clarity

represents.modernity_and_sophistication: Silver symbolizes modernity, sophistication, and calmness
represents.wealth_and_futurism: It represents wealth and futuristic ideas

effects.evokes_wealth: It evokes feelings of wealth and prestige
effects.can_feel_cold: Too much silver may feel cold or distant

description: Light silver is bright and reflective
It suggests clarity and innovation
Dark silver is rich and elegant
It conveys sophistication and depth

represents.wealth_and_success: Gold symbolizes wealth, success, and luxury

effects.evokes_wealth: Gold evokes feelings of wealth and prestige
effects.can_feel_arrogant: Too much gold may feel arrogant or gaudy

description: Light gold is bright and radiant
It suggests positivity and wealth
Dark gold is deep and rich
It conveys luxury and sophistication
